question: When was the first global torch relay undertaken?
explanation: The first global torch relay was undertaken in 2004, a journey that lasted 78 days. The Olympic flame had covered a distance of more than 78,000 km in the hands of some 11,300 torchbearers, travelling to Africa and South America for the first time, visiting all previous Olympic cities and finally coming back to Athens for the 2004 Summer Olympics.
